description: Binary A/B format prompts for speech detection. A always maps to SPEECH, B to NONSPEECH.

templates.text:
Does this audio contain human speech?
A) Yes
B) No

Classify this audio clip:
A) Human speech present
B) No human speech

Listen to the audio. Is there human voice?
A) Speech detected
B) No speech detected

Audio content classification:
A) Contains human vocal communication
B) Does not contain human vocal communication

Binary decision - does this clip contain speech?
A) Yes, speech is present
B) No, speech is absent

Detect human voice in audio:
A) Human voice detected (syllables, words, conversational cues)
B) No human voice detected

Task: Speech detection. Select one:
A) Speech
B) Non-speech

Is human speech the dominant content?
A) Yes, speech dominates
B) No, other content dominates (music, tones, noise, silence)

Classify audio based on human vocal tract activity:
A) Vocal tract activity detected (formants, syllabic rhythm)
B) No vocal tract activity

Example: [crowd noise + music] â†’ B
Now classify the new audio:
A) Speech
B) Non-speech

Conservative classification (only select A if clearly present):
A) Human speech clearly audible
B) No speech OR speech unclear

Liberal classification (select A for any hint of speech):
A) Any hint of human voice (even faint/short)
B) No human voice at all
